did.abstract: Various programs of the television program Dialogue which aired on WKRC-TV (Cincinnati, Ohio). This series was a joint production of WKRC and the National Conference of Christians and Jews.

bioghist.head: History of
bioghist.p: Dialogue was a series of weekly Sunday morning television programs which aired in the 1980's and 1990's. This program was produced by the National Conference of Christians and Jews and WKRC-TV. The introduction to each program mentioned that Dialogue was "an exchange of views by persons of different faiths on current social and religions issues." Moderated chiefly by Edward Brueggeman, S.J., each show included a team of panelists drawn from local Cincinnati-area clergy and other professional groups. Video copies of these selected programs have been archived with the permission of WKRC-TV (Cincinnati, Ohio) for educational or research purposes only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Dialogue television series was a weekly Sunday morning program aired on WKRC-TV in Cincinnati, Ohio. Moderated by Edward Brueggeman, S.J. of Xavier University, this program invited ecumenical discussion on topics not only theological but also of modern social or political importance. Panelists were drawn from the clergy of local Cincinnati-area churches and from professionals of various disciplines.
